intro: Corydalis edulioides var. haimensis, commonly known as the Haimen corydalis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, branched stems and trifoliate leaves, with each leaflet being ovate to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
